item.title: Why COVID positivity rates and deaths don't always correlate
item.author: m.harper@outlook.com (Michael Harper)
item.description: Infection Rates The second important piece of information is the infection rate. This is provided by the ONS survey, with the data available here. Note the data is slightly out of date, and therefore will not provide me with loads of data for December. Simulate a death dataset Based on the two values, we can now simulate how death may vary with infection levels. To do this, I will take the daily infection rate, and project the expected level of death for the following time period.
